title: Waldo's Bags of Candy
question_text: Snack-sized bags of fruit-flavored candy are manufactured so that the weights are nearly normally distributed with a mean of $64\text{ grams}$ and a standard deviation of $1.5\text{ grams}$ .  It is reasonable to assume that the bags are packaged randomly for shipment to stores. Waldo purchased $12$ snack-sized bags of this fruit-flavored candy and found that the average weight of these bags was $63\text{ grams}$ . Does Waldo have reason to believe he was cheated? Calculate the probability of obtaining a sample mean less than or equal to $63\text{ grams}$ .

choices.text: The conditions for using the normal model are not met in this situation.
